abstract_summ: In December 2019, novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV)-infected pneumonia (NCIP) occurred in Wuhan, China . The number of cases has increased rapidly but information on the clinical characteristics of affected patients is limited . Of 138 hospitalized patients with NCIP, the median age was 56 years (interquartile range, 42-68; range, 22-92 years) and 75 (54.3%) were men . Hospital-associated transmission was suspected as the presumed mechanism of infection for affected health professionals and hospitalized patients .
